Rules on accounting standards for special accounting for educational expenses [Enforcement March 3, 2023] [Ministry of Education Ordinance No. 299, March 3, 2023, Partial Revision]  Article 10 (Definition and Recognition Criteria of Assets) ① An asset refers to a resource that is currently owned or controlled by the metropolitan and provincial offices of education as a result of past transactions or events and is expected to generate economic benefits in the future. ② Assets are recognized when they contribute to educational and artistic activities or when future economic benefits are likely to flow into metropolitan and provincial offices of education, and the amount can be reliably measured. Article 11 (classification of assets) ① Assets are classified into current assets, investment assets, tangible assets, intangible assets and other non-current assets. ② Delete <June 25, 2015> Article 12 (Current Assets) Liquid assets refer to cash and cash equivalents, short-term financial instruments, unpaid bonds, unpaid loans, short-term loans, advance payments and inventory assets that can be cashed or are expected to be realized within one year after the end of the fiscal year. Article 13 (Investment Asset) Investment assets refer to long-term financial products, long-term investment securities, and long-term loans held for the purpose of investment or exercise of rights. Article 14 (Tangible Asset) Tangible assets refer to assets used repeatedly or continuously for more than one year in educational and academic affairs, such as land, buildings, structures, educational and research equipment, machinery, books, furniture, vehicle transportation hemisphere, standing trees, museum relics, and assets under construction. Article 15 (Intangible Asset) Intangible assets are rights that can be used exclusively and exclusively for a certain period of time, including industrial property rights, copyrights, software and software development costs. Article 16 (Other Non-current Assets) Other non-current assets are assets that do not belong to the assets under Articles 12 through 15 and refer to long-term unpaid payments, deposits, long-term advance payments, and long-term advance expenses.

name: National Pathogen Resource List
description: The National Pathogen Resource List is a list of pathogen resources surveyed pursuant to Article 6 of the ⌋ on the Promotion of Collection, Management and Utilization of ⌈ Pathogen Resources ('National Pathogen Resource Status Survey') and is prepared every five years. Information such as resource number, resource name, resource classification (resource type), and biosafety level is provided, and information possessed by each resource is different.

name: National Science and Technology Standard Classification System
description: The National Science and Technology Standard Classification System is a national standard classification framework for information management and distribution, efficient human resource management, and efficient planning and management of R&D projects in the field of science and technology, and is an independent two-dimensional classification system for research and application fields. The research field is a three-tier classification system, consisting of 33 major categories, 369 subcategories, and 2,899 subcategories, and the application field is a one-tier classification system, consisting of 32 major categories.

name: Korea Insect Names Index
description: The Korea National Insect List is a list of insect species living in Korea that standardizes the names of confusingly used or misrepresented insects, minimizes errors, and organizes them. <The most basic process of insect taxonomy> The taxonomy and cataloguing of species is the most fundamental process of insect taxonomy. The completion of a standardized and unified list of insects living in Korea (scientific and national names) is an indispensable element of systematic national insect resource management. However, insect names are determined by the results of research in insect taxonomy, and there are also insect names that have not been clearly defined in accordance with ongoing research on insects, along with international conventions based on the Latin scientific method of selection. The names of insects known so far are also incorrectly recorded due to differences in interpretation, causing some problems. The National List of Insects is a list of insect species living in Korea that standardizes the names of these confusingly used or misrepresented insects, minimizes errors, and compiles them. The national standard insect list is continuously managed by reflecting the latest data on the insect name, and it will be provided to download it in the form of attached files on the Internet through central database work. As a result, the list of insects prepared across all fields related to general insects, including government ministries, related research institutes, and educational institutions, can be used

name: Configuration Item Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of the different Configuration Item types that are tracked and managed as part of the Configuration Management discipline and its related set of processes. Such Items may be composed of other smaller Configuration Items that they depend on and may also be used as dependencies for the construction of greater Items. In other words, some may be composed of pieces and/or act as pieces for others. Tracking of such dependencies is critical for most IT organizations and, as a result, some of the Configuration Items may be tracked in dedicated domain based systems and others may be tracked in formal Configuration Management Databases (CMDBs).

The National Mushroom List (Index of Korean Mushroom) is a list of national and scientific names based on the [Korean Mushroom List (2013)] and the [National List of Species (2015]], and reflects the latest scientific names by referring to the MycoBank Database and Index Fungorum. The newly changed genus name is given a name in consideration of morphological characteristics and original meaning to support the use of unified mushroom names

name: Korea Plant Names Index
description: The Korea Plant Names Index Committee is a list prepared by organizing plant names based on recent taxonomic research for standardization of plant names, and jointly reviewed and deliberated by the National Arboretum and the Korean Classification Society. The list supports systematic national plant resource management and the use of unified plant names, and is provided through a system that is updated in real time.

name: Korea Lichen Name Index
description: The Korea Lichen Name Index is a list prepared by organizing the names of lichens based on recent taxonomic research to standardize the names of lichens in Korea, and jointly reviewed and deliberated by the National Arboretum and the Korean Classification Association. The list supports systematic management of national lichen resources and is available for download on the Internet through real-time updates

name: Gugak Dictionary
description: The Dictionary of Gugak is a knowledge base in the fields of traditional Korean music, 歌, and dance. It provides an accurate and concrete understanding of Korean traditional music and traditional dance, and provides five senses of the reality and beauty of Korean traditional music and traditional dance through various media. To this end, we intend to expand the convenience of foreigners and information-vulnerable groups so that more people can use the Korean traditional music dictionary by making the terms and description of the Korean traditional music dictionary reflect academic research results, mobilizing the optimal media (writing, sound source, board, video, etc.).

name: Korean traditional music industry classification system
description: The Korean traditional music industry classification system is a classification used in the National Gugak Center's statistical survey of the Korean classical music industry (2019~). It was first included as a 2019 Korean classical music industry statistical survey [Appendix 1] and contains opinions on the classification as an appendix every year. It provides a comparison table with the Korean Standard Industrial Classification Table and aims to enter the national statistics of the 'Korean classical music industry statistical survey'.

name: List of marine and marine life resources subject to approval for export abroad
description: The list of marine and marine life resources subject to export approval is a list of marine and marine life resources designated by the Ministry of Oceans and Fisheries to restrict export to species of high economic, ecological, and academic value. In order to export, an application for approval, including the purpose and management plan, must be submitted and approved by the Minister of Oceans and Fisheries. The list is selected through expert evaluation and a review by the Committee on the Selection of Marine and Marine Life Resources subject to approval.

name: National Assembly Records Classification Standard Table
description: The National Assembly Records Classification Standard Table is prepared and operated by the head of the National Assembly Library based on the work process, and includes unit business names, explanations, documentation, and retention periods. The standard table is managed by the National Assembly Records Management System, and new or changed contents are posted on the National Assembly website by the end of March every year and notified to the relevant departments.

name: Detailed classification table by function of military supplies
description: Detailed classification table by function of military supplies is one of the classifications of military supplies prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Munitions Management Act and Chapter 2 of the Munitions Management Order in accordance with Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Munitions Management Act, and corresponds to the detailed classification table for each function in [Asterisk 3] of Article 10 (classification by function) of the Munitions Management Order.  National Legal Information Center - Article 10 of the Military Supplies Management Order (Ministry of National Defense Order No. 2942) (20241029) 1. Enforcement Decree of the Military Supplies Control Act [Enforcement July 2, 2019] [Presidential Decree No. 29950, July 2, 2019, Amendment to other laws] Article 3 (classification of military supplies, etc.) In order to efficiently manage military supplies, the Minister of National Defense shall classify military supplies by use, function, and nature, or as prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense.  2. Enforcement Rules of the Military Supplies Control Act [Enforcement on October 25, 2021] [Ministry of National Defense Ordinance No.1068, October 25, 2021, amendment of other laws] Article 3 (classification of military supplies) The methods of classifying military supplies prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense pursuant to Article 3 of the Decree are as follows. <Amendment February 12, 2014> 3. Classification by function: Method of classification into firepower, maneuver, telecommunications electronics, special weapons, ships, aviation and general equipment, ammunition, duties, and other general materials [Professional revision November 6, 2009]  3. Military Supplies Management Order [Enforcement 2024.7.9.] [Ministry of National Defense Order No. 2942, 2024.7.9. Partial Revision] Chapter 2 Classification of Munitions Article 5 (Purpose of Classification) Munitions may be classified into the methods of classification under each subparagraph of Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Guns Management Act and Articles 8 through 13 of this directive in order to systematically perform the duties of the department in charge, budgeting and settlement of accounts, registration and management of the military information system, investigation and settlement of accounts. Article 10 (classification by function) Munitions shall be classified into firepower, special weapons, maneuvers, aviation, ships, telecommunications electronics, general equipment, precise measurement, tools, ammunition, duties, and materials by function pursuant to subparagraph 3 of Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Gun Goods Management Act. In this case, detailed classification by function shall be in accordance with attached Table 3 (Detailed Classification Table by Gun Goods Function).

name: Munitions inventory
description: Munitions inventory is a systematic integration of information on the classification, identification, and management of munitions, and is carried out in accordance with the Defense Acquisition Program Administration Act and related regulations. Its main purpose is to increase the efficiency of munitions management and to maintain a system consistent with international standards.  1. a key element legal basis In accordance with Article 27 of the Defense Acquisition Program Administration, the Defense Acquisition Program Administration classifies munitions by product name and inventory number, and manages them as munitions list information. Relevant laws and regulations require compliance with the International Listing System (NATO). Listing Process Item identification: Data generation including item name, inventory number, characteristic information, etc. Inventory number assignment: National inventory number system based on NATO inventory number (NSN). Manage and update: Maintain data consistency by modifying, deleting, and adding list information. international cooperation The Republic of Korea is a certified sponsor of the NATO Listing System, which utilizes common terms and procedures among NATO member states to carry out the listing. The Defense Acquisition Program Administration supports international exchange of list information and data integration. Coverage It is cataloged for items that are repeatedly procured, stored, and distributed among munitions, and technical materials, drawings, and specifications are used. It includes various types of munitions such as weapon systems, power support systems, and software. 2. Significance of Listing Military Supplies Listing ensures consistency and efficiency in data management throughout defense businesses, and enables international standardized information exchange. This ensures transparency and speed in the management and procurement of military supplies at home and abroad.

name: Configuration Management Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of the many different Configuration Management types that are tracked, managed and performed as part of the Configuration Management discipline and its related set of processes. These areas of Configuration Management concern themselves with their corresponding Configuration Types and, also, their correlating Configuration Item Types. While the Foundation acknowledges that each category has a different level of importance to different enterprises, the taxonomy serves to highlight just how many different areas of Configuration Management exist and that must be dealt with by many enterprises. Examples of how some of these types of Configuration Management categories fit into an enterprise can be seen in the IT Deployment Framework, which calls out the different, Deployment related Configuration Management Types.

name: Detailed classification table by type of military supplies
description: The Detailed classification table by type of military supplies is one of the classifications of military supplies prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Regulations of the Munitions Management Act and Chapter 2 of the Munitions Management Order in accordance with Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Munitions Management Act.  1. Enforcement Decree of the Military Supplies Control Act [Enforcement July 2, 2019] [Presidential Decree No. 29950, July 2, 2019, Amendment to other laws] Article 3 (classification of military supplies, etc.) In order to efficiently manage military supplies, the Minister of National Defense shall classify military supplies by use, function, and nature, or as prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense.  2. Enforcement Rules of the Military Supplies Control Act [Enforcement on October 25, 2021] [Ministry of National Defense Ordinance No.1068, October 25, 2021, amendment of other laws] Article 3 (classification of military supplies) The methods of classifying military supplies prescribed by Ordinance of the Ministry of National Defense pursuant to Article 3 of the Decree are as follows. <Amendment February 12, 2014> 2. Classification by Type: Methods of classification by general type, such as food, cladding, and weaponry  3. Military Supplies Management Order [Enforcement 2024.7.9.] [Ministry of National Defense Ordinance No. 2942, 2024.7.9. Partially amended] Chapter 2 Classification of Military Supplies Article 5 (Purpose of Classification) Munitions may be classified into the methods of classification under each subparagraph of Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Guns Management Act and Articles 8 through 13 of this directive in order to systematically perform the duties of the department in charge, budgeting and settlement of accounts, registration and management of the military information system, investigation and settlement of accounts. Article 9 (classification by type) Munitions shall be classified into 1 type (food), 2 types (general goods), 3 types (milk), 4 types (construction materials), 5 types (bulk goods), 6 types (welfare store sales), 7 types (equipment), 8 types (mandatory equipment/materials), 9 types (repair attachment/tools), 10 types (other goods) for each item with similar purpose, nature, and distribution method. In this case, detailed classification by type shall be in accordance with attached Table 2 (detailed classification table by type of county products).

name: Classification of military supplies
description: The Classification of Military Supplies is a method of classifying military supplies prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Regulations of the Military Supplies Management Act and Chapter 2 of the Military Supplies Management Order in accordance with Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Military Supplies Management Act.

name: Climate Change Words Explanation
description: Climate Change Words Explanation is a booklet that selects and solves related words related to key terms that are frequently used from the public's perspective among terms on the causes and effects of climate change. There is a booklet and a wiki version, and the original PDF can be downloaded by the "download" button, and the "shortcut" button connects to the climate change science terminology explanation wiki. The explanation wiki for climate change science terminology is a wiki of the booklet.

name: North-South Forest Comparison Glossary
description: The North-South Forest Comparison Glossary is a comparison of inter-Korean forest terms published in 2021 by the National Institute of Forest Science. For the smooth forest cooperation project between the two Koreas, the terms used in the overall forest fields such as planting and afforestation, forest pests, and all directions were investigated for two years, and published after expert advice. In the future, follow-up work will be conducted through advice from forest experts and Korean language experts (pre-editing experts).  *an investigated and organized dictionary The investigation and arrangement were conducted based on the forest terminology dictionary published by the South and the North. The South Korean terminology was based on the preliminary ⌋ of ⌈ forest forestry terms, and was organized by reflecting the ⌋ of ⌈ forest administration purification terms additionally announced by the Korea Forest Service. The North Korean terminology was used as basic data by investigating the North Korean terminology corresponding to the ⌈ Forest ⌋ Terminology Dictionary ⌋ published by North Korea in 2020 and the inspection of experts by field.

name: Classification System of Science and Technology for Food, Agriculture, and Forestry
description: The Classification System of Science and Technology for Food, Agriculture, and Forestry was created to efficiently manage information, manpower, and R&D projects related to agriculture, food, science and technology. It is linked to the National Science and Technology Table Classification System.  1. History Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Notification No. 2014-126: Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Science and Technology Classification System Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Notification No. 2019-84: Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Science and Technology Classification System

name: Agricultural data classification system
description: The Agricultural Data Classification System was developed for the systematic management of relics owned by the National Agricultural Museum and data in the domestic agricultural field. This classification system can be found on page 65 of the 2023 National Agricultural Museum's annual report.

name: Standards for Classification of Places of Business for Air Pollutant-Emitting Facilities
description: The Standards for Classification of Places of Business for Air Pollutant-Emitting Facilities classifies workplaces from 1 to 5 types according to the amount of pollutants generated from air pollutant discharge facilities.

name: Categories of Urban Agriculture
description: The categories of urban agriculture is a type of urban agriculture prescribed in Article 8 (1) of the Act on the Promotion and Support of Urban Agriculture, and when the State and local governments foster and support urban agriculture, they establish and implement policies to suit the characteristics of each type of urban agriculture under paragraph (1). Detailed classification by type is prescribed in Article 2 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act on the Promotion and Support of Urban Agriculture.

name: Classification System of Diagnosis and Treatment of Animals
description: The Classification System of Diagnostics and Treatment of Animals is a standardized classification system for animal care, such as animal disease names and treatment items, announced by the Minister of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs for the systematic development of animal care. In the Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs' Notice No. 2024-30, "Recommended Standards for Animal Care," the recommended standard medical procedures for animal hospital frequent treatment items (20 types) are set as an asterisk, and detailed medical guidelines according to the standard medical procedures are prepared by the head of the veterinary clinic and provided to the veterinarian by posting them on the website of the veterinarian association. The standard medical manual can be checked only by signing up as a member of the Korean Veterinary Medical Association, and membership can be registered after checking only those with veterinarian license numbers.

name: Display HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines
description: The Display HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines is the first of four guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service and was produced in accordance with the implementation of HS 2022. HS standard analysis guidelines for secondary batteries, semiconductors, and automobiles are provided, including this guideline in the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal.  Display, the first impression of electronic products, has endless growth potential as a key item that leads Korea's exports along with semiconductors such as 83% of global market share of OLED. Accordingly, the Korea Customs Service made various efforts to establish international standards for item classification for related goods, and as a result, international standards commonly used by all countries were newly established (No. 8524) from '22.1.1, further enhancing the convenience and predictability of item classification.  <Volume 1> Display HS Standard Analysis Guidelines It contains HSK information on a total of 285 related items, including the newly changed Display Module (No. 8524) in 22 years and equipment and raw and subsidiary materials used to manufacture them. Item classification is essential information for customs clearance, trade transactions, and statistics for various policy-making, and anyone can easily and quickly check the item number by using this guide if they have the existing HSK and product information.

name: Data Entity Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key Data Entities that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge. Such information is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.

name: Classification of Weapons Systems
description: Classification of Weapons Systems classifies weapons for combat power in battlefields, such as guided weapons, aircraft, and ships, and integrated elements such as equipment, parts, facilities, and software necessary to operate them

name: Munhwanuri card Affiliate store classification system
description: The Munhanuri card Affiliate store classification system classifies the merchants who can use the Munhanuri card* into major, middle, sub-class, and business and items. The classification table can be found in the "Businesses and Items Registered as Affiliate" section of the "Manghanuri website">Manghanuri card>Manghanuri card registration guide, and the non-permitted businesses and items of the Munhanuri card can also be found. Meanwhile, since 2019, the company has been posting posts related to the "Manghanuri card merchant classification table and prevention of illegal use" on its website notices, so you can check the previous classification information.

name: Goods classification guidelines
description: Goods classification guidelines are guidelines for classifying goods of central administrative agencies established under the Constitution or the Government Organization Act or other laws, and are guidelines prescribed by the Article 5 of the Commodity Management Act

name: Semiconductor HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines
description: Semiconductor HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines are one of the guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service and are provided by the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal. The HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal provides guidelines for HS standard analysis for displays, secondary batteries, and automobiles, including this guideline.  Consisting of two sectors, the first half (standard interpretation guidelines) included item numbers for 258 types of raw materials, parts, and equipment for each semiconductor production process, and photos and detailed explanations for each product, and the second half (technical data collection) explained the latest semiconductor information and trends, semiconductor power generation process, semiconductor production process, and technical terms along with diagrams to help basic understanding of semiconductors, making them widely available not only to industry officials but also to related policy authorities.

name: Standards for classification of cost components of defense cost-eligible materials
description: The Standards for classification of cost components of cost components of defense cost are classified into material costs, labor costs, expenses, general management costs, and profits.

name: Disease and Pest Information(by Disease and Pest):Insect
description: Insecticide and Pest Information: Insect is a list of 'insect' information provided by the National Agricultural and Plant Disease Control System. In this list, basic information about insects (Korean species, species name, full name/cultivation name, tree/cultivation name, genus name, English name, quarantine information), target natural insect information, crop damage information, and insect photo information are provided. Information provided for each insect may be different.

name: Classification of Health and Medical Service Technology
description: The Classification of Health and Medical Service Technology is a classification system for efficiently managing information, manpower, research, and development projects related to health and medical technology and is stipulated in Article 7-2 of the Health and Medical Technology Promotion Act (Preparation of the Health and Medical Technology Classification System). When creating a health and medical technology classification system, it must be prepared in connection with the national science and technology standard classification table, and measures such as improvement shall be taken by reviewing the feasibility every three years.

name: Industrial Accident Insurance Premium Rates by Business Type and Examples of Business Types
description: Industrial Accident Insurance Premium Rates by Business Type and Examinations of Business Types is a classification of industrial accident insurance rates paid by employers for compensation for workers' occupational accidents by industry, and the Minister of Employment and Labor announces the premium rates for 28 business types by December every year. The business type example table stipulates tax items and content examples to apply the premium rates for each industry.

name: Classification of Fields of Service for Social Service Personnel
description: The Classification of Fields of Service for Social Service Personnel is a classification of areas in which social service personnel should serve as stipulated in Article 47-3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Military Service Act pursuant to Article 26 (3) of the Military Service Act.

name: Industrial Technology Classification Table
description: 산업기술분류표(Industrial Technology Classification Table)은 산업기술혁신사업의 기획ㆍ평가ㆍ관리에 관한 업무를 효율적으로 추진하기 위해 수립한 분류체계의 분류표이다. 이 분류표는 '산업기술혁신사업 공통 운영요령 제16조'에 의하여 '동 행정규칙 별도표1 산업기술분류표' 에서 정하고 있다.

name: Document Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of the different enterprise Discipline related Document types or classifications. Such types are used by IT Professionals and the enterprises they provide services to as a means of identifying, defining, classifying, organizing, storing, and publishing different enterprise documents. This taxonomy is critical to multiple enterprise Disciplines such as Document Management, Artifact Management, and Records Management. Such taxonomies are commonly used in Document Management Systems as a means of tagging Documents as a means of assisting in organization and search.

name: Industry Association Table Sector Classification
description: The Industry Association Table Sector Classification is a classification system used to prepare the Bank of Korea's Input-Output Table (statistics table), which includes product classification and industry classification. The classification can be confirmed as follows. 'Bank of Korea Economic Statistics System > Statistical Search > Statistics Table > 2.2 Input-Output Table > 2.2.n. yyyyy Year Actual Table > 2.2.n.1 File Download'  Example) 2020 Input-Output Table Division Classification: Bank of Korea Economic Statistics System>Statistics Search>Statistics Table>2.2 Input-Output Table>2.1. 2020 Measurement Table>2.1.1 File Downloads> 2020 Segment Classification Table

name: Commercial information system industry classification
description: Commercial information system industry classification is a commercial analysis data provided by the commercial information system of the Ministry of SMEs and Startups, which is divided into major, middle, and sub-classification, and is searched in sub-classification units. The classification information can be checked as an Excel file in the notification information in the system, and it provides free information necessary for start-ups and management by analyzing commercial districts, competitions, locations, and profits.

name: Service Industry Classification
description: Service Industry Classification is a classification of industries related to the service industry based on a major classification in the Korean Standard Industrial Classification. The Korean Standard Industrial Classification (KSIC) consists of the following 16 major categories (E, G, U) based on the major categories Code : Classification Name E: Water, sewage and waste disposal, and raw material regeneration business	 G: Wholesale and retail business	 H: Transportation and warehouse business I: Accommodation and restaurant business	 J: Information and communication business	 K : Financial and insurance businesses	 L: Real estate business	 Man: Professional, scientific and technical service industries N: Business facility management, business support, and rental service business O: Public administration, defense and social security administration P: Education service industry Q: Health and social welfare services R: Arts, sports and leisure services S: Associations and organizations, repair and other personal services businesses T : Employment activities in households and self-consumption production activities U: International and foreign institutions

name: Election Commission Records Classification Standard Table
description: The Election Commission Records Classification Standard Table is prepared and operated in accordance with the records management rules of the permanent records management agency, and includes management items such as job description, retention period, storage place, and disclosure status. Records are created and managed by the records management system, and new records and changes are notified to the information and communication network every year. In the case of administrative information data sets, a separate management standard is prepared and operated.

name: Classification of Juvenile Training Centers
description: The Classification of Juvenile Training Centers is the classification of juvenile detention centers pursuant to Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Act on the Treatment of Protected Juvenile, etc. by classifying them into elementary and secondary education, vocational competency development training, medical rehabilitation, etc. by function, and multiple names may be used. Multiple names of juvenile centers shall be in accordance with the guidelines on the functions and multiple use of names of juvenile centers, etc

name: Classification of Fire Equipment
description: The Classification of Fire Equipment is classified according to its purpose and function, and is stipulated in Articles 6 and [Attachment 1] of the Enforcement Decree of the same Act under Articles 2 (1) and 8 of the Fire Equipment Management Act. Matters concerning the classification criteria, procedures, detailed items, etc. of fire fighting equipment classified in the Enforcement Decree [Attachment 1] shall be prescribed in Articles 3 and 4 of the Regulations on the Classification of Fire Equipment, etc. and [Attachment 1].

name: Veterinary medical terminology:English-Korean·Korean-English
description: Veterinary medical terminology (English-Korean, Korean-English) is the first veterinary terminology published in 2006 jointly by the Korean Veterinary Society and the Korean Veterinary Society. It contributed greatly to education and research in the field of veterinary and livestock by unifying difficult Chinese character expressions and inaccurate foreign language notation of veterinary terms used at the time.

name: List of infectious livestock pathogens subject to import permission
description: The list of infectious disease pathogens subject to import permission is a list of pathogens for infectious diseases of animals provided by the Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs Administration. It also provides a list of exemptions for import permission.  Article 32 (3) of the Livestock Infectious Disease Prevention Act and [Regulations on the Management of Veterinary Life Resources for Livestock Infectious Diseases Pathogens, etc.] *Release the list to the website of the Korea Veterinary Life Resources Bank (http://kahis.go.kr:9000/kvcc) at the bottom of Appendix 1 and **Attachment 2 from time to time. *[Attached Table 1] Special management pathogens: Type 1 livestock infectious disease pathogens specified in the Livestock Infectious Disease Prevention Act (hereinafter referred to as the "Home Appliance Act") and pathogens designated by the head of the Agriculture, Forestry and Livestock Quarantine Headquarters (hereinafter referred to as the "head of the quarantine headquarters") **[Attached Table 2] General management pathogens: Pathogens other than special management pathogens among Class 2 and 3 livestock infectious diseases specified in the Home Appliance Act, pathogens designated by the head of the quarantine headquarters (Attached Table 2), and other pathogens of infectious diseases of animals

name: Treatment Level of Sentenced Inmates
description: The treatment level of Sentenced Inmates is the treatment level of prisoners prescribed in Articles 72, 73, 74, and 76 of the Enforcement Regulations of the Penal Execution Act. The treatment level is divided into basic accommodation level, security treatment level, and individual treatment level. Inmate: The term "inmate" means a person who has been sentenced to imprisonment, imprisonment, or detention and has been imprisoned in a correctional facility and has been imprisoned in a correctional facility with an order to attract a labor center for failing to pay fines or fines in full. Treatment grade: The term "treatment grade" means a standard for distinguishing facilities to accommodate inmates, the degree of accounting for inmates, the level of treatment and the contents of treatment in relation to the treatment and management of inmates.

name: Korea New and Renewable Energy Center Terms
description: The Korea New and Renewable Energy Center Terms is a dictionary related to new and renewable energy that allows you to check terms and explanatory information. It is provided on the website of the Korea Energy Agency's New and Renewable Energy Center. You can check terms in alphabetical order.

name: Professional sign language dictionary Psychology Alphabetical index
description: The conceptual list was prepared by deaf and hearing students of the Department of Psychology at the University of Hamburg, taking into account suggestions from deaf pedagogy as well as psychological and psychotherapeutic work with deaf people, including the introductory literature of the seven subject areas of general psychology, biopsychology, differential psychology , Developmental and pedagogic psychology, clinical psychology, cognitive psychology and social psychology, and was compared with already existing psychological specialties, with the aim of selecting a basic vocabulary for a psychological study at a predefined upper limit of about 1000 terms Of the employees from their studies were included in the selection.Systematic aspects could only be considered to a very limited extent Nter are references to the existing sign language variants for this entry. If you click on one of the reference pictures, the display will jump to the part of the lexicon entry belonging to this variant below. These include supplementary information on the lemma: common abbreviations (ABK), synonyms (AUCH), or, in the case of conceptual pairs, the connotation (eg 'Efference': 'AUCH: Gegenbegriff: Afferenz'). Below the definition text are listed the top terms to which the respective term can be assigned. The subject areas, with the exception of the applied psychology, are divided into a total of 37 terms. An upper term was recorded if at least 4 items could be assigned to it. The upper concepts were not further hierarchized among themselves, since this would have been possible only in very few cases. They also do not always agree with the terms of the technical terms, e.g. (Learning, observation, learning, distributed, etc.) are to be found under the heading 'learning and learning theories'. The lemmas, which could not be assigned to a specific concept within a discipline, are to be found under an umbrella term which is nominally identical to the subject area. The lexicon is primarily intended for deaf students and interpreters. However, it also offers valuable information and suggestions for all persons who use sign language in psychological contexts (psychologists, medical practitioners, educators, social workers / social workers and others).

name: File Plan Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of the different File Plan Types or Categories that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations, professionals and their business clients, such as Records Management Organizations, to help identify, define, manage, and support the many different File Plan Types that are used to facilitate, both, File Plan Management and Records Management solutions.

name: ARKO Arts Archive collections Description
description: The ARKO Arts Archive collections Description is a material that introduces the archives of the ARKO Arts Archive*. It provides a detailed list and overview of the archives currently planned and produced or collected by the ARKO Arts Archives.  *The Arko Art Archives collects, preserves, and serves important records that examine the flow of modern and contemporary Korean art history, and also promotes records production projects such as oral records and performance visualization projects. Additionally, various programs such as exhibitions, education, and research based on collection records are carried out while books, records, and videos that are highly related to the history of modern and contemporary Korean art are purchased and serviced.

name: Malodor-Emitting Facilities Classification
description: Malodor-Emitting Facilities Classification is a facility designated by the Minister of Environment in consultation with the heads of relevant central administrative agencies pursuant to subparagraph 3 of Article 2 of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor and Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act, and includes facilities, machinery, equipment, etc. that cause odors. The specific classification of the relevant facilities is specified in attached Table 2 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor, and shall be managed by reflecting the amendments every year. The facilities for discharging odors under subparagraph 3 of Article 2 of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor shall be prescribed in Article 3 of the Enforcement Rules of the Act on the Prevention of Malodor, and facilities for discharging odors shall be as shown in attached Table 2.

name: Children's Book Research Society Keyword Dictionary
description: The Children's Book Association Subject Heading Theseaurus is a tool that supports the search of children's and adolescents' book recommendation lists as subject words and related words together to support effective search. *The Children's Book Research Association selects good children's books every year and recommends them to <<Children's and Youth Books>>. Since 1995, recommended lists have been published every year and distributed free of charge to public and private libraries, community children's centers, and local bookstores, which can also be searched on the website of the Children's Book Research Association. The recommended list can also be searched as a subject word, and the subject word dictionary is a dictionary that can be used to search for the subject word, and words related to the subject word can also be viewed.

name: Trade Secret Classification Guide
description: The Trade Secret Classification Guide is a guide for calculating and classifying secret grades of information and data held by companies. Technology information such as R&D and production and management information such as personnel, general affairs, accounting, purchase and sales are representative of the information held by companies. Such information can be protected as trade secrets only when it meets economic usefulness, non-publicity, and confidentiality. In particular, the court makes it a major criterion for reviewing whether general information and trade secrets are separately managed when determining whether confidential management is satisfied in the event of a trade secret leakage accident. However, companies have complained of difficulties in classifying and rating their information because there has been no adequate standard for systematic secret grade classification so far. Accordingly, it is intended to support companies to efficiently establish trade secret management strategies by presenting the criteria for selecting appropriate protection measures (patents, trade secrets, etc.) for information held by companies, and by presenting a method of calculating the grade of information managed as trade secrets and an appropriate level of management for each grade. This guide was derived through the research ⌋ (Korea Intellectual Property Office, 2016) to establish a classification system for ⌈ trade secret data, and can be modified and utilized to suit the reality of each company.

name: Classification of Outdoor Advertisements
description: Classification of Outdoor Advertisements is a classification of outdoor advertisements under Article 3 of the Enforcement Decree of the Outdoor Advertisement Act, and is a display method for five types of advertisements, such as advertisements that require consultation between central administrative agencies, rooftop signboards corresponding to advertisements of wide area characteristics, landowners' signs, and advertisements using transportation facilities. The method of displaying remaining advertisements not prescribed by this Act shall be determined by city/provincial ordinances. Outdoor advertisements: The term "outdoor advertisements" means signs and digital advertisements (including those displayed on transportation facilities or means of transportation prescribed by Presidential Decree) that are always exposed to the public or continuously for a certain period of time and can be seen in places where the public freely passes (including those displayed on transportation facilities or means of transportation prescribed by Presidential Decree), signboards, banners, wallpapers, and leaflets (傳單) and other similar ones.

name: Online dictionary of environmental terms: 50 key terms
description: Online dictionary of environmental terms: 50 key terms A dictionary of environmental terminology published in 2018 by the Ministry of Environment's policy promotion team. Fifty major terms were selected from the online environmental terminology dictionary and explained in an easy-to-understand manner the policy systems and related concepts related to recent environmental issues. The contents are largely divided into 1. environmental conservation, 2. air transportation, 3. climate future, 4. water environment, 5. natural conservation 6. resource circulation, and 7. environmental general. You can read the original text at the Environmental Digital Library.

name: Choi's Thesaurus
description: Korean Thesaurus: The relationship between the description of terms and terms (Choi's Thesaurus) is a control vocabulary for Korean words that structures the relationship between the semantic information of terms and related terms. Most algorithms for processing unstructured data have already been developed and known, but structured data are required to process them more precisely. To this end, terms have been collected since 1993 under the goal of constructing metadata for Korean terms that have a relationship between semantic information and terms, and they have been described as standard thesaurus structure. Thesaurus is widely known as a form of structuring terms and concisely abstracts complex relationships between terms. In this dictionary, the standard thesaurus structure is basically adopted and additionally expanded. The subject of the registered terms includes nouns such as subject name, life, institution/organization name, place name, animal name, plant name, legal name, literature name, monument name, product name, meeting/assembly name, event name, etc., and verbs and adjectives. As of August 2013, 1.3 million terms (800,000 terms in Korean, 510,000 terms in foreign language. See statistical functions for more information) were registered and terminology relationships were defined. Although it is not yet sufficient, it is thought that we have constructed a sufficient amount of data to process unstructured data in the field to some extent, so we will disclose the results so far. More than 10,000 terms of new terms are added every month, and this work will continue along with the revision work.

name: Urimalsaem
description: Urimalsaem is a user-participating dictionary that collects and creates words used in real life, newly emerged words, and words used in the region with the people.  Introduce the Korean language fountain 1. What's a Korean word fountain? When I'm curious about the use of Korean, I look for a Korean dictionary. However, there are times when I feel disappointed because there is no information or it is difficult to explain even when I look for a dictionary. This is because there are various restrictions on the dictionaries published so far, so the information has been compressed and included in a limited way. The Korean Language Sam, in which the user participates, was designed to overcome this problem. All of us who speak Korean want to be the main subjects and include vocabulary that was used before or is currently used in a more diverse and easy-to-understand manner. In addition to traditional dictionary information, it also aims to provide various language knowledge to answer many questions about the Korean language. 'Korean Horse Spring' encompasses various fields such as new words, dialects, and technical terms. In addition to the words in the "Standard Korean Dictionary" published by the National Institute of the Korean Language, there have been many words that have not been published in the Korean dictionary but are actually used. It started with a million words, but the number will continue to increase. In "Korean Sam," anyone interested in Korean can participate in editing. Until now, editing of dictionaries has been exclusive to dictionary experts. "Korean Language Sam" opens up editing so that anyone interested in Korean can share their Korean knowledge. "Korean Horse Sam" aims to increase the reliability of the information contained through expert supervision. In "Korean Horse Sam," experts from each field participate to check the newly edited content and refine the expression.  2. Characteristics of the Korean horse's gland Openness - It contains Korean materials in various fields such as new words, dialects, and technical terms - End User Joins Edit - Free use of information with knowledge donations based on free copyright policies Connectivity - Application of international standards to enable information exchange and connection with domestic and foreign institutions - Enhanced secondary utilization of information on portable devices, Internet sites, etc Practicality - Provide a variety of language information needed by the general public - Apply user-friendly, web-based environments

name: Amusement Devices or Amusement Rides Classification
description: The Assignment Devices or Amnesty Rides Classification is the classification of organic facilities or organic equipment* for safety inspection. In the Enforcement Regulations of the Tourism Promotion Act, it is divided into organic facilities or organic equipment subject to safety inspection and organic facilities or organic equipment not subject to safety inspection.  *GAME MACHINE OR GAME MACHINE It means facilities, equipment, etc. installed to be used in a standardized manner within a certain space by utilizing machinery, electricity, electronic devices, etc. for the purpose of providing fun, enjoyment, and thrill to users. ( Provided, That this shall not apply to buildings that have obtained permission, authorization, etc. pursuant to other Acts and subordinate statutes, such as the Building Act, and to organic facilities or auxiliary facilities of organic equipment.)

name: Classification and List of Noxious Liquid Substances
description: Classification and List of Noxious Liquid Substances is a classification and list of hazardous liquid substances under Article 2, Item 7 of the Marine Environment Management Act, and is stipulated in Article 3 and [Asterisk 1] of the Rules on Prevention of Pollution in Ships. [Asterisk 1] Detailed criteria and substance list for classification of hazardous liquid substances 1. Detailed criteria for classification of hazardous liquid substances 2. List of hazardous liquid substances

name: Glossary Taxonomy
description: The following represents a hierarchical taxonomy of key Enterprise and Information Technology (IT) Glossary Types or Categorizations, along with dynamic HTML links to their semantically grouped Term/Definition pairs. These Glossaries are used by IT organizations, IT professionals and the various enterprises they support to help standardize language, semantics, understanding and communications between individuals and systems and represent the very foundation for Enterprise Knowledge Management.

name: Secondary Battery HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines
description: The Secondary Battery HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines is one of the guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service, which is the second guideline after the display. It is provided by the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal. The HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal provides guidelines for HS standard analysis for displays, semiconductors, and automobiles, including this guideline.

name: Automobile Parts HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines
description: The Automobile Parts HS Standard Interpretation Guidelines is one of the guidelines for item classification for the national strategic industry produced by the Korea Customs Service, and is the fourth HS standard analysis guideline after displays, secondary batteries, and semiconductors. It is provided by the HS Guide of the Customs Law Information Portal. This guideline contains the item number (HS 10 units) of 242 major car parts, photographs and detailed descriptions of the corresponding items. This guideline consists of three parts and includes general parts, eco-friendly car parts, and the latest automotive industry trends.

name: Classification of Disaster Management Commodities
description: The Classification of Disaster Management Commodities is one of the classifications of disaster management resources specified in the 'Notification on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources, etc.'

name: Classification of Disaster Management Human Resources Organizations
description: The Classification of Disaster Management Human Resources Organizations is one of the classifications of disaster management resources stipulated in the 'Notice on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources', and human resources institutions are classified into management institutions and institutions, organizations, and corporations by function.

name: Disaster Management Resources Catalog Number System and Assignment Method
description: The Disaster Management Resources Catalog Number System and Assignment Method establishes the criteria for creating a list of disaster management goods and the method of granting a list number as stipulated in the "Notice on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources, etc.

name: Classification of Disaster Management Resources
description: The purpose of the Classification of Disaster Management Resources is to prescribe the criteria for classification of disaster management goods and the criteria for the list of goods, the criteria for property list, the criteria for the list of human resources, the criteria for the list of human resources, and the method for granting the list number under Article 25 (1) of the Act on the Management of Disaster Management Resources, etc. and Article 19 (1) 2 of the Enforcement Decree of the same Act.

name: Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Type of Disaster and Accident
description: The Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Type of Disaster and Accidents is one of the classifications of disaster management resources specified in the 'Notice on Classification Standards for Disaster Management Resources, etc.' and is a classification of disaster and accident types for efficient use and linkage of disaster management resources.

name: Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Collaboration Functions
description: The Classification of Disaster Management Resources by Collaboration Functions is one of the classifications of disaster management resources stipulated in the 'Notice on Classification Standards of Disaster Management Resources, etc.' and classifies physical and human resources into groups or teams in consideration of collaboration functions for efficient use and linkage of disaster management resources.

name: Classification of] Disaster Management Property
description: The Classification of Disaster Management Property is one of the classifications of disaster management resources prescribed in the 'Notice on Classification Standards, etc. of Disaster Management Resources', and is a classification of assets by type. This facilitates the classification and identification of disaster management resources, and disaster management property is classified according to the criteria specified in attached Table 3. This notification stipulates that the feasibility is reviewed every three years so that improvement can be made.

name: Types of Force Support Systems
description: Types of Force Support Systems is a classification of all elements such as equipment, parts, facilities, software, and other goods other than weapons systems, and is classified in Article 2-2 of the Enforcement Decree of the Defense Acquisition Programming Act, and detailed classification is determined in Article 7 of the Defense Electric Power Generation Ordinance and [Attachment 5].

name: Governance Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat representation of key forms of Governance that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help manage themselves and to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge within their enterprises. Such information is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.

name: Exhibition Industry Classification
description: According to Article 22 (Standard Classification) of the Statistics Act, the Exhibition Industry Classification is a special classification of the exhibition industry by subdividing the exhibition-related industrial activities among the Korean Standard Industrial Classification for administrative purposes such as statistics and policy execution.

name: Encyclopedia of Library and Information Science
description: The Encyclopedia of Library and Information Science is a classification theory that explains the theoretical basis required for structuring knowledge, including understanding, explanation, and practical level of a specific classification system. In addition, it sought a classification system that could accommodate various past knowledge structures. As an appendix, the restaurant script is included.

name: Business Reference Model
description: The Business Reference Model (BRM) classifies administrative agency tasks based on unique functions and defines classified tasks and related information. The classification system by function systematizes them into policy fields, policy areas, large functions, medium functions, small functions, and unit tasks. This system is designed to clearly define and efficiently manage the tasks performed by the government, and related data can be found in the Ministry of Public Administration and Security and the Government Organization Management Information System. The term "functional classification of administrative affairs" (hereinafter referred to as "functional classification") means classifying the affairs of an administrative agency based on its own functions and defining information related to the classified affairs. The "classification system for each function" classifies the duties regularly performed by the government into policy fields, policy areas, major functions, medium functions, small functions, and unit tasks according to the level of function.

name: Grading of Major Communications Facilities
description: The Grading of Major Communications Facilities (Grading of Major Communications Facilities) is based on the criteria by which major telecommunication business operators classify facilities that need protection in consideration of the matters referred to in Article 23-3 (1) of the Enforcement Decree of the Framework Act on Broadcasting and Communication Development.

name: Ironmaking Technology in the Jungwon Region: A List of Ironmaking Sites
description: The Ironmaking Technology in the Jungwon Region: A List of Ironmaking Sites shows that the Jungwon region is optimized for iron production thanks to the Namhan River water system and its abundant resources such as iron ore, charcoal, and clay. About 20 ironmaking sites have been excavated from the Three Kingdoms period to the Joseon Dynasty in Chungcheongbuk-do, and in particular, in Chungju, 96 ironmaking sites and 456 coal tanks were identified at 45 sites, proving that iron production was actively carried out. Representative relics include Jincheon Seokjang-ri, Gusan-ri, Chungju Chilgeum-dong, Daehwa-ri, and Cheongwon Yeonje-ri.

name: Severity Classification Table
description: The Severity Classification Table is a method of classifying casualties occurring at a disaster site. The rules on emergency rescue response activities and on-site command are in accordance with the severity classification table in Appendix 7, and are classified into four stages: death, emergency, emergency, and non-emergency.

name: Earthquake Terminology
description: Earthquake Terminology is a terminology description of earthquakes among earthquake information (common sense related to earthquakes) provided by the Jeju Disaster and Safety Countermeasures Headquarters. It provides terminology and brief explanations.

name: National Portrait List
description: A portrait is a painting of a specific person. In ancient documents, the names Jin 眞, Yeong 影, Jinyoung 眞影, Yeongjeong 影幀, and Burn 畫 were used. During the Joseon Dynasty, as the idea of Sunghyeon, which honors and honors ancestors, became widespread, portraits of kings and royal figures or ordinary nobles were actively produced. The National Institute of Cultural Heritage's Art and Cultural Heritage Research Center will push for the "Korea Portrait DB Construction Project" to make it easier and more convenient for Koreans to find state-designated portraits scattered across the country in one place. In particular, we would like to contribute to the research and enjoyment of our art heritage by allowing us to look at portraits that were difficult for the general public to access because they were owned by individuals, families, and private institutions in ultra-high-resolution images of more than 100 million pixels. The number of state-designated portraits to be presented in this project is 83 cases and 131 national treasures, 7 national treasures, 76 treasures, and 106 portraits are as follows.

name: Taekwondo Term Dictionary
description: The Taekwondo Term Dictionary is a complete revision of the Taekwondo Technical Dictionary published by Kukkiwon in 2010. The 215-page dictionary summarized the terms by dividing the Taekwondo skill system diagram into △ attack techniques (scratching, stabbing, shooting, hitting, kicking, breaking, turning over), △ defense techniques (blocking, subtracting, avoiding) △ assistive techniques (standing, jumping, catching, pushing, preparation posture, special items). The term dictionary contains not only the terms and meanings of each technology, but also examples in which the terms can be used in various ways and useful information not presented in the meaning solving. In particular, the institute tried to help readers understand by including photos of members of the Taekwondo Demonstration Team of Kukkiwon, which embodied terms in the dictionary of terms. In addition, all technologies posted in the term dictionary can be checked by video using QR codes.

name: Standard Terminology Dictionary
description: The Standard Terminology Dictionary is a service that allows the National Institute of Technology and Standards to build and search 100,000 KS terms (the terms that exist in the KS standard book) in a database (DB) through e-National Standard Certification (www.standards.go.kr ), an integrated government-wide standard and certification search portal. Through the standard term dictionary search, industrial and academic workers can easily find and use technical terms.

name: Inventory Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key Inventories that are used and should be maintained by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals. Such Inventories help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge that are important to IT Organizations, IT Professionals, and their Business Stakeholders. Specifically, maintaining current and up to date Inventories is a best practice that ensures better transparency into the enterprise and which leads to good operational metrics for better decision making. Such a Taxonomy is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. These constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology
description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology contains definitions of terms that are essential for understanding Korean archaeology and summarize the most basic concepts and important relics excavated and investigated in Korea

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology(English Edition)
description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology (2014) is an English version of the dictionary using the Korean archaeological dictionary and specialized dictionary by field to share representative research results of Korean archaeology with foreign academia and enhance foreign researchers' understanding of Korean ancient history. It includes the definition of terms that are essential for understanding Korean archaeology and summarize the most basic concepts and important relics excavated and investigated in Korea. It also introduced related relics from neighboring countries, such as Japan, China, and Russia, which are directly related to Korean archaeology.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Burial Goods in the Ancient Korean Graves
description: The Korean 考 Dictionary of Archaeology: 典 of Ancient 墳遺 專 (Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Burial Goods in the Ancient Korean Graves) contains terminology explanations for more than 600 important artifacts excavated from ancient tombs in Korea, making it easier for the general public to understand difficult archaeological terms.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Ancient Tombs
description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Ancient 墳篇 典: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Ancient Tombs compiled relics and conceptual terms from the end of the early 考 to Unified Silla, and includes materials related to Korean history located not only on the Korean Peninsula but also abroad such as China and Japan.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:The Paleolithic
description: The Korean Archaeological Dictionary: The Paleolithic 專 典: The 舊 of 考 Archaeology: The Paleolithic is divided into categories of concepts, relics, achievements, and the status of world-famous Paleolithic ruins in Korea, and consists of more than 500 terminology explanations, drawings, and plates, as well as the distribution of historical headings by region and personality.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:The Paleolithic(English Edition)
description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: The Paleolithic (English Edition) is an English version of the "Korean Archaeological Dictionary - The Paleolithic," published in Korean by the National Institute of Cultural Heritage in 2013, and contains the research results of the Korean Paleolithic Age, which have been excavated and investigated until recently, including previously included contents. 73 important Paleolithic sites excavated in Korea, such as the title of "Research Status and Tasks of the Paleolithic Age in Korea" and the "Pocheon Neulgeori Ruins," were selected as the title words, and the research results were included along with photos and drawings.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Production Sites
description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Production Sites is a collection of research results related to production sites such as kilns, ironmaking, and workshops on the Korean Peninsula, and includes 342 conceptual titles and 1,513 historical titles.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:CatlesㆍSignal Fires
description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Catles (Signal Fires) is a dictionary that compiles the results of research on fortresses and beacon in Korean archaeology and prepares an official term unification plan.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:Neolithic Age
description: The Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: Neolithic Age describes the achievements of archaeology in the Korean Neolithic Age by dividing the achievements of archaeology into categories such as relics, relics, and concepts, explaining the terms and organizing the main data. In addition to the Korean Peninsula, research results from regions close to our Neolithic culture, such as China, Japan, and Russia, were included, and drawings and plates were included to help readers understand using this dictionary.

name: Dictionary of Korean Archaeology:The Bronze Age
description: It is an augmented edition dictionary composed of domestic (I·II) and foreign (III) by supplementing the latest research results made since the publication of the Dictionary of Korean Archaeology: The Bronze Age in 2004, and contains a total of 2,132 cases, including 221 conceptual headings (130 domestic and 91 overseas) and 1,911 historical headings (1516 domestic and 395 overseas).

name: IT Discipline Taxonomy
description: The following represents a linear or flat taxonomy of key IT Disciplines that are used by Information Technology (IT) organizations and professionals to help define, structure, organize, and understand various forms of Data, Information, and Knowledge associated with the many Discplines performed by IT Organizations and their IT Professionals, both, for themselves and for their business stakeholders. Such information is often used as a foundation for data modeling, especially in the design, definition, and implementation of other Taxonomies and Ontologies. Such constructs are also often used as mechanisms to provide clarity and standardize terminology for communications between business stakeholders and IT organizations.

name: Encyclopedia of Korea Culture
description: The Korean National Encyclopedia of Korean Culture was created as a result of a long-term research project in Korea after 1980 by compiling Korean culture for the first time. It contains the most authoritative knowledge information about Korean culture and was written by professional researchers in each field of Korean studies. It is an encyclopedia that allows you to understand the in-depth of Korean culture, such as "Laughter," "恨," and "ghost." It is a dictionary of encyclopedia that does not stop making revisions in order to be reborn as a dictionary that meets the demands of the times.

name: Korean Classification of Crime for Statistical purposes
description: The Korean Classification of Crime for Statistical Purpose (KCCS) is a classification system based on the International Classification of Crime for Statistics (ICCS) adopted by the UN Statistical Commission (UNSC) in March 2015. It is a classification to increase the consistency and comparability of crime statistics, and in the classification, 'crime' is regarded as a violation 'action' that exceeds the limit of human behavior punishable by law. It is important to note when using the classification that the Korean Crime Classification is a classification for the purpose of collecting and using statistics, and crime is systematically categorized (classified) according to the type of behavior, and may differ from the existing criminal justice statistics.

name: List of Plant Diseases in Korea
description: The online List of Plant Diseases in Korea provides plant names, disease names, pathogen names and related documents for all diseases that occur in Korean plants. In addition, we would like to provide pictures of the disease's disease and pictures of pathogen microscopy and culture. (G)The Plant Pathology Review Committee of the Korean Plant Pathology Association manages information and provides related systems at the National Agricultural Science Institute of the Rural Development Administration. This online list of Korean botanical names reflects the "Korean Botanical Names List 6.2th Edition (2024)." The 6.2nd edition contains 1,432 taxa hosts and 6,765 disease names that occur there.

name: Korean-Foreign LanguageLearners' Dictionary
description: The Korean-Foreign Language Learners' Dictionary is a dictionary that translates the title and meaning of the "Basic Korean Dictionary" into 11 languages and is particularly useful for beginner Korean learners. Korean Basic Dictionary/Korean-Foreign Language Learning Dictionary 1. Korean - Russian 2. Korean - Mongolian 3. Korean - Vietnamese 4. Korean - Spanish 5. Korean - Arabic 6. Korean - English 7. Korean - Indonesian 8. Korean - Japanese 9. Korean - Chinese 10. Korean - Tires 11. Korean - French

name: Korean History Thesaurus
description: The Korean History Thesaurus is designed to classify historical terms into 13 themes and life, place names, signatures, and cultural properties so that users can access them without knowing the exact terms. The terms are arranged in a hierarchical structure and can be used as a search dictionary, and they help you understand the historical context by providing information such as the content, time, and year of the terms. The Chinese character notation uses Unicode to prevent conversion errors and maintains a flexible structure considering the convenience of users' search.

name: Folk religion of villages in Korea
description: Polk Religion of Villages in Korea is a survey of village community beliefs that are currently handed down at the National Folk Museum of Korea. Due to various factors such as industrialization, urbanization, and migration, village beliefs are rapidly disappearing, and the scale is reduced in local village communities, including large cities, and the form is changing briefly, but village beliefs are still being handed down. This is because there are still people who try to protect village beliefs. From this point of view, it is necessary to observe and record how village beliefs are maintained and how they are changing. In 2007, the National Folk Museum of Korea published an on-site survey report on Korean village beliefs on a nationwide basis from 2005 to 2006. In addition, from 2022, the National Folk Museum of Korea divides the whole country into six regions, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, and conducts a survey of village beliefs by region and records them. Through the record of the survey table on the status of village beliefs included in the survey report, it is possible to find out whether the village beliefs continue and disappear over time.

name: Folk religion of villages in Korea:Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do
description: South Korea's Village Faith: Gwangju Metropolitan City, South Jeolla Province (Polk Religion of Villages in Korea - Wangju Metropolitan City and Jeolanam-do) Starting in 2022, the National Folk Museum of Korea has divided the whole country into six regions, including Seoul, Gyeonggi, Incheon, Gyeongsang, Jeolla, Chungcheong, Gangwon, and Jeju, and is conducting a survey on village beliefs by region. Due to various factors such as industrialization, urbanization, and migration, village beliefs are rapidly disappearing, and the scale is reduced and the form is changed briefly in local village communities, including large cities, but village beliefs are still being handed down. This is because there are still people who try to protect village beliefs. From this point of view, it was necessary to observe and record how village beliefs are maintained and how they are changing. In 2023, a survey of village beliefs was conducted in the Jeolla and Jeju areas. As a result, a report on village beliefs (total of 3 volumes) in ⌈ Korea was published following the Chungcheong area in 2022. This report is composed of three volumes: Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, Jeollabuk-do, and Jeju Special Self-Governing Province. In Gwangju Metropolitan City and Jeollanam-do, a total of 49 regions, including 7 Gwangju Metropolitan City and 42 Jeollanam-do, were included. And in Jeollabuk-do, 35 regions of village beliefs were included. In addition, 40 regions of Jeju Special Self-Governing Province included village beliefs. Meanwhile, each report included a list of whether or not it was transmitted for comparison with the 2007 survey on the current status of village beliefs.

name: Village Beliefs in Korea:Daegu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do
description: Village Beliefs in Korea: Daegu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do (Village Beliefs in Korea: Degu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do) is part of a survey of village beliefs by region conducted by the National Folk Museum of Korea, which is the record of Daegu Metropolitan City and Gyeongsangbuk-do among the Gyeongsang village beliefs surveyed in 2024. The National Folk Museum of Korea is preparing a list of village beliefs transmission status table, or continuous status of village beliefs, while investigating village beliefs, and the survey report includes a list of village beliefs transmission status table in Gyeongsangbuk-do in Daegu Metropolitan City in 2024.
